Fun Fact: The Cavalier King Charles spaniel was heavily interbred with the pug and Japanese chin to the point where its appearance became virtually unrecognizable. A contest sponsored by American aristocrat Roswell Eldridge in the 1920s led to the resurgence of the breed in its original form, and the Cavalier portion of the name was added at this time to reflect its origins.
Name: Cavalier King Charles Spaniel
